Job Title: Automotive Export Compliance Specialist  

Location: Greensboro, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing

Description:
Export Control AnalystGreensboro, NC, USAFull-timeContract/country: UnlimitedJob family: Supply chainCompany DescriptionAccelerate your career with a fast-growing global engineering group. At SEGULA Technologies, you'll work on exciting projects and help shape the future in a company where innovation goes hand in hand with engineering.3D printing, augmented reality, autonomous vehicles, the factory of the future... these are the daily rhythms of our 10,000 ingenious employees, so why not yours?Whether next door or on the other side of the world, at SEGULA Technologies you'll find the opportunity that will give new meaning to your career!Job DescriptionAs the Customs Master Data (Export Control Classification) Senior, you will be key in aligning with the business strategy for trade compliance.Export classification is the enabler for securing compliant trade of goods with military characteristics or with goods subject to the Export Administration Regulation.These will be some selected responsibilities:Act as the main speaking partner for classification of any product development including military adaptation of vehicles in US legal entities. Responsible for regulatory monitoring of Export Administration Regulations and DDTC Regulations and impact analysis on Group ECCN and ITAR classifications.Active in global development of knowledgebase for Export Control Classification in our community of dual-use classification.Drive export/import impact analysis in case of new or updated sanctions as it relates to export classifications.Drive classification investigations for sensitive products or technology.Set the priorities for our classification operations by analytics and forecasts for US exportsQualificationsTo be successful in this position you have a bachelor's degree in engineering, International Trade, or equivalent experience. Prior experience with Export Administration Regulations, DDTC and Commodity Jurisdiction experience preferred. Certified Export Specialist certification is preferred. Your leadership skills, networking capabilities, and learning mindset will be an essential asset for the position.The role requires digital and analytics competence where you are comfortable in processing large amounts of data and drive action plans based on conclusion made from data analytics.Furthermore, the candidate will act as the liaison for our business areas. Interacting with head of legal counsel; head of sales; and head of engineer. Also work with special projects, where you will be exposed to ITAR technology, US EAR 600-series technology or governmental projects. Therefore, the candidate must be a US citizen and cannot have multiple citizenships due to technology export requirements.This role is located in Greensboro, NC and requires frequent travel to Shippensburg, PA and other global locations as required.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
